subject: Climate & Environment
title: Pollution and Pregnancy
description: A quick win: understand Pollution and Pregnancy.

hook.text: Air pollution can harm a baby before it takes its first breath.

buildup.text: Fine particles cross the placenta. Soot has been found in fetal tissue.

discovery.text: Exposure during pregnancy is linked to low birth weight, preterm delivery, and stillbirth.

twist.text: Even moderate pollution levels â€” common in many cities â€” carry measurable risk.

climax.text: Clean air during pregnancy is a health intervention as powerful as good nutrition.

punchline.text: Every child's health story starts with the air their mother breathed.

quiz.question: How does air pollution affect pregnancy?
options: It increases risk of low birth weight and preterm delivery
It has no effect on fetuses
